Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of "C" (2.0) or better in ENC 1102 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Women's writings in the Americas from the 17th century through the mid-19th century.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102 .

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Major American writers from beginning through Whitman.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Major American writers from Twain to present.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: PR: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Linguistic, literary, and cultural elements of American writing through various time periods and genres.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines how novels and short stories by contemporary U.S. women define identity from diverse woman-centered and feminist perspectives.

AML3682H - Honors Ethnic Literature in A.name: AML3682H - Honors Ethnic Literature in America

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Permission of Honors and ENC 1102H or equivalent credit.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Contributions of linguistic and ethnic groups of non- English origin to the literature of the United States. Honors content.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1101 and ENC 1102.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Native American genres, including traditional oral narratives, ritual and contemporary poetry, autobiography, and the novel.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: A comparative approach to African American and Caribbean writers, focusing on literary styles, historical contexts, and themes such as nationalism, popular music, and folk religion.

AML3273 - Beat Literature and Other Mid-.name: AML3273 - Beat Literature and Other Mid-Century Writers

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Study of the poetry and prose of the Beat Literary Movement of the 1950s and 1960s and other American Writers of that period.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of "C" (2.0) or better in ENC 1102 or equivalent.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Development of Southern literature from its beginnings in the "Old South" through the post-Civil War and the Southern Renaissance to the present. Emphasizes readings from writers such as Poe, Chopin, Faulkner, Porter, Williams, O'Connor, Percy, and Styron.

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: Grade of C (2.0) or better required in ENC 1102.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Literary representations of New World slavery in the past and the present.

Course Description.text: This course will examine writers who have lived in and written about Florida, such as Hemingway, Rawlings, Hurston, and Stevens.
